intro: Henckelia petiolaris, commonly known as the leafy mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees, deriving some of its nutrients through specialized structures called haustoria. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged in opposite pairs along its slender stems. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, often clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are dispersed by birds. Due to its parasitic nature, it can have significant ecological impacts on its host trees.
